text: russia has formally warned the united
states and its allies against supplying
further weapons to ukraine
the kremlin said that the arms shipments
could lead to what it called
unpredictable consequences speaking
during an interview president zielenski
has acknowledged that up to 3 000
ukrainian soldiers have died and as many
as 10 000 have been left injured since
russia invaded his country in february
meanwhile there have been reports of new
strikes on the outskirts of the
ukrainian capital kyiv and also
explosions have been heard in the
western city of levive
and in the last hour the russian foreign
ministry has said that it's banning the
british prime minister boris johnson as
well as other senior ministers from
entering russia over the uk's hostile
stance on the war in ukraine the bbc's
helena wilkinson has the report

this was once one of russia's most
prized warships now the moskva lies at
the bottom of the black sea it's a huge
blow to the country and its naval power
ukraine claimed it hit the cruiser with
two missiles russia denied this saying
an explosion on board caused it to sink
the country held a ceremony to mourn its
loss
for ukrainians the sinking of the
warship is a morale boost many have
queued to buy this stamp showing a
ukrainian border guard defiantly
standing up to the vessel
but there have already been
repercussions russia says it hit a
military facility outside the ukrainian

it's threatened more strikes on kiev if

the kremlin has also issued a warning to

saying supplying further arms to ukraine

lead to unpredictable

if someone says a year or years i answer

the stronger opposition will be and the

ukrainian police say they found the

the capital remains a target and there

bbc news
well our correspondent dan johnson is in

a reminder to people here that even

it said in response to ukrainian
